reviewText: Basil Rathbone was an Afrikkaner whose family relocated to Britain when Basil was 3 years old. Rathbone began appearing on stage in 1911, but his acting career was interrupted by war service four years later. Rathbone's first film role was in 1921. He had a somewhat undistinguished career until 1939, when he was fortuitously paired with Nigel Bruce (as Dr. John Watson) in the first of 14 Sherlock Holmes mysteries. The last movie Rathbone acted in was released in 1968, a year after his death (heart attack-- age 75).CONTENTSSHERLOCK HOLMES AND THE SECRET WEAPON is curiously set in modern times and involves a bombsight the Allies are trying to keep from the Nazis. All of Doyle's characters are here, including the evil Prof. Moriarity, and none are worse for wear with the half-century time shift.DRESSED TO KILL is also set in the year of its release, 1946. This last Rathbone/Bruce pairing involves missing Bank of England printing plates, three music boxes and murder.TERROR BY NIGHT is the tale of a famous diamond stolen while being transported via train from Edinburgh to London. The son of the Star of Rhodesia's owner is murdered, and Holmes has to figure out which of the train's passengers did it.THE WOMAN IN GREEN is Hillary Brooke (of the Abbott & Costello TV show). The trail of a series of murders leads right to the lady in this story's title.SHERLOCK HOLMES: The Complete Seriesstars Ronald Howard as the famous sleuth and contains all 39 half-hour episodes of that popular 1954 American-made TV show..Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website.(6.9) Dressed To Kill  (1946) - Basil Rathbone/Nigel Bruce/Patricia Morrison(6.8) Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon (1943) - Basil Rathbone/Nigel Bruce/Lionel Atwill/Dennis Hoey(7.0) Terror by Night (1946) - Basil Rathbone/Nigel Bruce/Alan Mowbray/Dennis Hoey(6.8) The Woman In Green (1945) - Basil Rathbone/Nigel Bruce/Hillary Brooke/Henry Daniell
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection

reviewText: These are great shows and will remain timeless! Good clean mysteries that the entire family can enjoy.
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection

reviewText: The set is one of my favorite movies and I truely enjoy them each time I watch the. The qality is very good and I find them better than my VHS copies from ten years ago. I will be getting more of these soon.
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection

reviewText: I always enjoy a good Sherlock Holmes movie.  Basil Rathbone is a classic Sherlock Holmes.  He is my favorite next to Ronald Howard in the short series of Sherlock Holmes TV movies made.  Always a must watch.
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection

reviewText: Maybe I got a lemon. The quality of this disc is almost unwatchable. The picture is blurry and the sound is distorted.
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection

reviewText: This contains one Dual layer (DVD9) disk.It contains four movies and a short bio about sherlock HolmesThe movies are:Dressed To KillSherlock Holmes and the Secret WeaponTerror by NightThe Woman In GreenBonus Feature, About Sherlock HolmesTotal run time 4 hours and 28 minutes.The sound track is above average and the video is clean, but a bit softfocus to me. However for the age and the price of the movies quite acceptable.
Title: Basil Rathbone Signature Collection
